domains.name: Empirical Observation
domains.description: Knowledge derived from direct sensory experience and experimentation, forming the foundation upon which we build models of reality. It provides the raw data that fuels our understanding of the world and tests the validity of our theories.

domains.name: Rational Analysis
domains.description: The domain of logic, mathematics, and critical thinking. It provides the tools to analyze empirical data, construct coherent theories, and derive new knowledge through deduction and inference. It ensures internal consistency and allows us to explore abstract concepts beyond direct observation.

domains.name: Ethical Reasoning
domains.description: Knowledge concerning values, principles, and moral obligations. It guides our actions and decisions, shaping how we interact with each other and the world. Ethical reasoning provides a framework for evaluating the consequences of our knowledge and ensuring its responsible application.

domains.name: Creative Expression
domains.description: The domain of art, literature, music, and other forms of creative endeavor. It allows us to explore subjective experiences, communicate emotions, and generate new perspectives on the world. Creative expression enriches our understanding of human nature and expands the boundaries of knowledge through imagination and innovation.

domains.name: Historical Context
domains.description: Knowledge of past events, cultural traditions, and societal developments. It provides a framework for understanding the present and anticipating the future. Historical context allows us to learn from past mistakes, appreciate the diversity of human experience, and recognize the evolving nature of knowledge itself.
